intro: Selinum ostericum, commonly known as the lesser calamity, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Selinum ostericum is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
